column2: AK DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
column4: Alaska
column6: AK

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Warning signs normally are:
column4: diamond-shaped.
column6: triangles.
column8: rectangles.

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Steep grade ahead
column6: No trucks allowed
column8: Do not pass trucks

column2: 3. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.
column6: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column8: when feeling angry or upset.
column10: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.

column2: 4. Taking drugs and alcohol together:
column4: helps you get rid of the effects of alcohol in your body.
column6: has no effect on your general driving ability.
column8: increase the risk of causing a crash.
column10: is no more dangerous than alcohol by itself.

column2: 5. What are some telltale signs of a drunk driver?
column4: Sudden stops.
column6: Weaving between lanes.
column8: Driving slower than the normal flow of traffic.

column2: 6. When drivers see this road sign:
column4: they must treat it as a 4-Way Stop sign.
column6: they must come to a complete stop and call the police.
column8: they must not drive past this sign.

column2: 7. After drinking, which of the following can help you sober up?
column4: Wait some time. Only time eliminates the effects of alcohol.
column6: drink black coffee. The caffeine will eliminate the effects of alcohol.
column8: Take a cold shower.

column2: 8. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Stop sign
column6: Flashing red light
column8: Red light

column2: 9. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column8: slow down before entering the curve.
column10: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: You must yield the right-of-way ahead
column6: Traffic signals ahead
column8: You must stop ahead

column2: 11. When you make a left turn from a two-way road into a four-lane highway, you must:
column4: enter the left lane, to the right of the center line.
column6: enter the right lane. When traffic permits, you can move out of the left lane.
column8: go straight through the intersection, and then make the turn.
column10: enter the right lane, to the left of the center line.

column2: 12. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 13. The effect that alcohol has on your judgment and reflexes:
column4: is less if you were only drinking beer.
column6: is greater if you were drinking whiskey or hard liquor.
column8: depends on the amount of alcohol in your blood stream.
column10: is less if you were only drinking wine.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway ends ahead.
column6: Reversible lane ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 15. When a driver has their left arm and hand extended upward, the driver plans to:
column4: go straight ahead.
column6: turn right.
column8: turn left.

column2: 16. When getting ready to pass, you should:
column4: honk your horn to signal your intention to pass.
column6: stay well back from vehicle ahead for better sight distance.
column8: pull up close to the vehicle in front of you as safely as possible.
column10: swing out across the center line to better see the road ahead.

column2: 17. At night, it is hardest to see:
column4: street lights.
column6: pedestrians.
column8: other motorists.

column2: 18. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: Merging traffic ahead
column6: Pedestrian crossing
column8: Come to a full stop

column2: 19. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Brake early and gently.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Allow the wheels to keep turning.

column2: 20. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
